column1: CMOR Table Omon: Monthly Mean Ocean Fields, Including Biogechemical Fields
(All Saved on the Ocean Grid)
In CMOR Table Omon: Marine Biogeochemical 2-D Fields
priority
column2: long name
column4: comment
column5: questions & notes

column2: Surface Concentration of (+name of tracer)
column3: mol m-3 or kg m-3 or 1, consistent with first table in Oyr
column5: Concentrations of all 3D tracers in the uppermost ocean layer. See first table in Oyr for a complete list of these tracers.  "Tracer"  concentations should be reported even if they are diagnosed rather than prognostically calculated.
column9: mol m-3 or kg m-3 or 1, consistent with first table in Oyr
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Primary Organic Carbon Production by All Types of Phytoplankton
column4: Vertically integrated total primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton.  This should equal the sum of intpdiat+intpphymisc, but those individual components may be unavailable in some models.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Primary Organic Carbon Production by Phytoplankton Based on Nitrate Uptake Alone
column4: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton based on nitrate uptake alone

column2: Primary Organic Carbon Production by Diatoms
column4: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the diatom phytoplankton component alone
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Diazotrophs
Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Calcareous Phytoplankton
Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Picophytoplankton
Primary Organic Carbon Production by Other Phytoplankton
column4: Vertically integrated total primary (organic carbon) production by other phytoplankton components alone

column2: Iron Production
column4: Vertically integrated biogenic iron production
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Silica Production
column4: Vertically integrated biogenic silica production

column2: Calcite Production
column4: Vertically integrated calcite production
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Aragonite Production
column4: Vertically integrated aragonite production

column2: Downward Flux of Particle Organic Carbon
column5: at 100 m depth.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Downward Flux of Particulate Iron
column5: at 100 m depth.

column2: Downward Flux of Particulate Silica
column5: at 100 m depth.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Downward Flux of Calcite
column5: at 100 m depth.

column2: Downward Flux of Aragonite
column5: at 100 m depth.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Content
column4: Vertically integrated DIC

column2: Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Delta PCO2
column5: Difference between atmospheric and oceanic partial pressure of CO2 (positive meaning ocean > atmosphere)

column2: Delta PO2
column5: Difference between atmospheric and oceanic partial pressure of O2 (positive meaning ocean > atmosphere)
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Surface Downward CO2 Flux
column4: Gas exchange flux of CO2 (positive into ocean)

column2: Surface Downward O2 Flux
column4: Gas exchange flux of O2 (positive into ocean)
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Surface Upward DMS Flux
column4: Gas exchange flux of DMS (positive into atmosphere)

column2: Flux of Carbon Into Ocean Surface by Runoff and Sediment Dissolution
column4: Carbon supply to ocean through runoff and sediment dissolution (neglects gas exchange)
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Downward Carbon Flux at Ocean Bottom
column4: Carbon loss to sediments

column2: Nitrogen Fixation Rate in Ocean
column4: Vertically integrated nitrogen fixation
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Surface Downward Net Flux of Nitrogen
Nitrogen Loss to Sediments and through Denitrification
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Surface Downward Net Flux of Iron
column4: Iron supply through deposition flux onto sea surface, runoff, coasts, sediments, etc

column2: Iron Loss to Sediments
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Oxygen Minimum Concentration
column10: time: mean area: where sea depth: minimum

column2: Depth of Oxygen Minimum Concentration
column4: Depth of vertical minimum concentration of dissolved oxygen gas (if two, then the shallower)
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Calcite Saturation Depth
column4: Depth of calcite saturation horizon (0 if < surface, "missing" if > bottom, if two, then the shallower)

column2: Aragonite Saturation Depth
column4: Depth of aragonite saturation horizon (0 if < surface, "missing"  if > bottom, if two, then the shallower)
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Carbon
column5: integral over upper 100 m only.

column2: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Nitrogen
column4: Net time rate of change of nitrogen nutrients (e.g. NO3+NH4)
column5: integral over upper 100 m only.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Phosphate
column4: vertical integral of net  time rate of change of phosphate
column5: integral over upper 100 m only.

column2: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Iron
column4: vertical integral of net time rate of change of dissolved inorganic iron
column5: integral over upper 100 m only.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Silicate
column4: vertical integral of net time rate of change of dissolved inorganic silicate
column5: integral over upper 100 m only.

column2: Rate of Change of Alkalinity
column4: vertical integral of net time rate of change of alkalinity
column5: integral over upper 100 m only.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Carbon due to Biological Activity
column4: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic carbon
column5: integral over upper 100 m only.

column2: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Nitrogen due to Biological Activity
column4: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of nitrogen nutrients (e.g. NO3+NH4)
column5: integral over upper 100 m only.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Phosphate due to Biological Activity
column4: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of phosphate
column5: integral over upper 100 m only.

column2: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Iron due to Biological Activity
column4: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic iron
column5: integral over upper 100 m only.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Silicate due to Biological Activity
column4: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic silicate
column5: integral over upper 100 m only.

column4: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of alkalinity

column1: In CMOR Table Omon: WGOMD Table 2.3
priority
column2: long name
column4: comment
column5: questions & notes

column2: Sea Water X Velocity
Sea Water Y Velocity
Upward Ocean Mass Transport
column4: differs from CMIP3, which only had upward velocity.

column2: Square of Upward Ocean Mass Transport
Ocean Mass X Transport
Ocean Mass Y Transport
Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction
column4: differs from CMIP3 because it includes mass.
column5: function of latitude, Z, basin. For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction", listed a few lines down, which should in this case be omitted.  For other models, this transport should be approximated as the transport along zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate to the model's resolution.

column2: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction
column5: function of of latitude, rho, basin.  Also see note above.

column2: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction
column5: function of Y, Z, basin.   Also see note above.

column2: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction
column5: function of Y, rho, basin.  Also see note above.

column2: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction due to Bolus Advection
column5: function of latitude, Z, basin.   Also see note above.

column2: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction due to Bolus Advection
column5: function of latitude, rho, basin.  Also see note above.

column2: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction due to Bolus Advection
column5: function of Y, Z, basin.  Also see note above.

column2: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction due to Bolus Advection
column5: function of Y, rho, basin.  Also see note above.

column2: Northward Ocean Heat Transport
column5: For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Ocean Heat Y Transport", listed a few lines down, which should in this case be omitted.  For other models, this transport should be approximated as the transport along zig-zag paths corresponding to latitudes with spacing between latitudes appropriate to the model's resolution.

column2: Northward Ocean Heat Transport due to Bolus Advection
column5: see note above.

column2: Northward Ocean Heat Transport due to Diffusion
column5: see note above.

column2: Ocean Heat X Transport
Ocean Heat Y Transport
column5: For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid, this is the same as the "Northward Ocean Heat Transport", listed a few lines above, which should be saved instead of this.

column2: Ocean Heat Y Transport due to Bolus Advection
column5: see note above.

column2: Ocean Heat Y Transport due to Diffussion
column5: see note above.

column2: Ocean Heat X Transport due to Bolus Advection
Ocean Heat X Transport due to Diffusion
Northward Ocean Heat Transport
column5: This differs from a similar, previous entry in that northward transport across individual basins is called for, rather than the fully gridded fields..

column2: Northward Ocean Heat Transport due to Bolus Advection
Northward Ocean Heat Transport due to Diffussion
Northward Ocean Heat Transport due to Gyre
column5: function of latitude, basin

column2: Northward Ocean Heat Transport due to Overturning
column5: function of latitude, basin

column2: Northward Ocean Salt Transport due to Gyre
column5: function of latitude, basin

column2: Northward Ocean Salt Transport due to Overturning
column5: function of latitude, basin

column1: In CMOR Table Omon: WGOMD Table 2.4

sea water transport through (or associated with) the following straits, openings, channels, passages, etc.:  barents_opening, bering_strait, canadian_archipelago, denmark_strait, drake_passage, english_channel, pacific_equatorial_undercurrent, faroe_scotland_channel, florida_bahamas_strait, fram_strait, iceland_faroe_channel, indonesian_throughflow, mozambique_channel, taiwan_luzon_straits, and windward_passage.  For definitions see WGOMD document referenced above.  All transports will be stored in a single variable with a dimension that covers the set of regions listed here.
priority
column2: long name
column4: comment
column5: questions & notes

column2: Sea Water Transport

column1: In CMOR Table Omon: WGOMD Table 2.5
priority
column2: long name
column4: comment
column5: questions & notes

column2: Rainfall Flux where Ice Free Ocean over Sea
column4: computed as the total mass of liquid water falling as liquid rain  into the ice-free portion of the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
column10: time: mean area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea

column2: Snowfall Flux where Ice Free Ocean over Sea
column4: computed as the total mass of ice directly falling as snow into the ice-free portion of the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
column10: time: mean area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea

column2: Water Evaporation Flux Where Ice Free Ocean over Sea
column4: computed as the total mass of water vapor evaporating from the ice-free portion of the ocean  divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
column10: time: mean area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea

column2: Water Flux into Sea Water From Rivers
column4: computed as the river flux of water into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Water Flux into Sea Water From Icebergs
column4: computed as the iceberg melt water  flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Water Flux into Sea Water From Icebergs
column4: computed as the iceberg melt water  flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
column5: If only the vertically integrated melt water flux is available, report as this 2-d field; otherwise the row above should be used.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Water Flux into Sea Water due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics
column4: computed as the sea ice thermodynamic water flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
column5: The priority set by the WGOMD was 2 for this field.  The sea-ice folks requested that the priority be raised to 1.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Water Flux into Sea Water
column4: computed as the water  flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.  This is the sum of the next two variables in this table.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Water Flux into Sea Water Without Flux Correction
column4: computed as the water  flux (without flux correction) into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
column5: This should probably be the sum of the first 6 variables in this table.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Water Flux Correction
column4: Positive flux implies correction adds water to ocean.
column5: If this does not vary from one year to the next, report only a single year.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column1: In CMOR Table Omon: WGOMD Table 2.6
priority
column2: long name
column4: comment
column5: questions & notes

column2: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water due to Rainfall
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water due to Evaporation
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water From Rivers
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics
column4: This variable measures the virtual salt flux into sea water due to the melting of sea ice. It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.
column5: The priority set by the WGOMD was 2 for this field.  The sea-ice folks requested that the priority be raised to 1.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water
column5: If this does not vary from one year to the next, report only a single year.  Positive flux implies correction increases salinity of water.  This includes all virtual salt flux, including that due to a salt flux correction.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Virtual Salt Flux Correction
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
column4: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.
column5: The priority set by the WGOMD was 2 for this field.  The sea-ice folks requested that the priority be raised to 1.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column1: In CMOR Table Omon: WGOMD Table 2.7
priority
column2: long name
column4: comment
column5: questions & notes

column2: Upward Geothermal Heat Flux at Sea Floor
column5: If this field is time-invariant, then save it instead as one of your "fixed" fields (see the fx table)
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Temperature Flux due to Rainfall Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water
column4: This is defined as "where ice_free_sea over sea"; i.e., the total flux (considered here) entering the ice-free portion of the grid cell divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
column10: time: mean area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea

column2: Temperature Flux due to Evaporation Expressed as Heat Flux Out of Sea Water
column4: This is defined as "where ice_free_sea over sea"
column10: time: mean area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea

column2: Temperature Flux due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water
column5: In general this should be reported as a function of depth, (i.e.,  it will be a function of the generic "XYZ" dimensions).  Include enough depth levels to represent  the non-zero values of this field everywhere on the globe.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Temperature Flux due to Runoff Expressed as Heat Flux into Sea Water
column5: If only the vertically integrated runoff flux is available, report as this 2-d field; otherwise the row above should be used.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Snow Thermodynamics
column5: In general this should be reported as a function of depth, (i.e.,  it will be a function of the generic "XYZ" dimensions).  Include enough depth levels to represent  the non-zero values of this field everywhere on the globe.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Snow Thermodynamics
column5: If only the vertically integrated heat flux is available, report as this 2-d field; otherwise the row above should be used.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Frazil Ice Formation
column5: As of May 2010, the WGOMD document recommends that this field should be saved instead of the field listed 2-lines below.  In general this should be reported as a function of depth, (i.e.,  it will be a function of the generic "XYZ" dimensions).  Include enough depth levels to represent  the non-zero values of this field everywhere on the globe.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Frazil Ice Formation
column5: If only the vertically integrated heat flux is available, report as this 2-d field; otherwise the row above should be used.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics
column5: The priority set by the WGOMD was 2 for this field.  The sea-ice folks requested that the priority be raised to 1.  As of May 2010, the WGOMD document recommends that instead of saving this field, the field listed 2-lines above should be saved instead.  In general this should be reported as a function of depth, (i.e.,  it will be a function of the generic "XYZ" dimensions).  Include enough depth levels to represent  the non-zero values of this field everywhere on the globe.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics
column5: If only the vertically integrated heat flux is available, report as this 2-d field; otherwise the row above should be used.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Iceberg Thermodynamics
column5: In general this should be reported as a function of depth, (i.e.,  it will be a function of the generic "XYZ" dimensions).  Include enough depth levels to represent  the non-zero values of this field everywhere on the globe.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Heat Flux into Sea Water due to Iceberg Thermodynamics
column5: If only the vertically integrated heat flux is available, report as this 2-d field; otherwise the row above should be used.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Surface Net Downward Longwave Radiation
column4: This is defined as "where ice_free_sea over sea"
column10: time: mean area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea

column2: Surface Downward Latent Heat Flux
column4: This is defined as "where ice_free_sea over sea"
column10: time: mean area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea

column2: Surface Downward Sensible Heat Flux
column4: This is defined as "where ice_free_sea over sea"
column10: time: mean area: mean where ice_free_sea over sea

column2: Net Downward Shortwave Radiation at Sea Water Surface
column4: This is the flux into the surface of liquid sea water only. This excludes shortwave flux absorbed by sea ice, but includes any light that passes through the ice and is absorbed by the ocean.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Downwelling Shortwave Radiation in Sea Water
column5: In general the shortwave flux should be reported as a function of ocean depth, (i.e.,  it will be a function of the generic "XYZ" dimensions).  Include enough depth levels to represent  the non-zero values of this field everywhere on the globe.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Heat Flux Correction
column5: If this does not vary from one year to the next, report only a single year.  Positive indicates correction adds heat to ocean.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column2: Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface
column4: This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any "flux adjustment") .
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column1: Ocean layer depth field requested only from models where it can't be calculated from the vertical coordinate information stored in the file.
